section.title: Using the Github Package
section.para: The Github package is designed to be a straightforward interface for working with Github. It is based on version 3 of the Github API. You can find documentation on the API at http://developer.github.com/v3/.

JGithub is built upon the JHttp package which provides an easy way to consume URLs and web services in a transport independent way. JHttp currently supports streams, sockets and CURL. It is possible to create a custom context and inject it into the JGithub class if one so desires.

section.title: Instantiating JGithub
section.para: This creates a basic JGithub object that can be used to access publically available resources on github.com.

section.title: Accessing the JGithub APIs
section.para:
The Github package is still incomplete, but there are four object APIs that have currently been implemented: Gists
Issues
References
Pull Requests

Once a JGithub object has been created, it is simple to use it to access Github:$pullRequests = $github->pulls->getList('joomla', 'joomla-platform');This will retrieve a list of all open pull requests in the specified repository.
